result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis D Penelton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
straight time
Consecutive to: with credit for 4 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
No contact with Joelisa T., except for telephone contact and electronic contact, until completion of 8 BIP classes, and with agent approval.

Batterer's Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Mental Health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review
***Court orders 10 day straight time, no good time COMMITMENT TO ISSUE for defendant's non-compliance with probation consditions.  January 16, 2015***

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dennis D Penelton not in court.  Jenna Merton appeared for the City of West Allis.
cab
A petition for return of property has been filed by Joelisa Thomas.  There is no objection by the City Attorney.
Court grants the petitioner's request.
Received, signed and filed:
Order.
Hearing concluded.
Return of property hearing at 12-17-2015 08:30 am
West Allis PD Inventory #2014001299 Item 1.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton not in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Probation Review Hearing. Defendant not appearing in court.  Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (10 days straight time).
Per e-mail from DOC agent, agent requests earlier review hearing for defendant. Case set for 1/16/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.
CORRECTION: Sentencing entry reflects corrected count numbers.
Due to scheduling conflict case is rescheduled from 2/13/2015 to 2/20/2015 at 1:30 pm in branch 23, DOC Court Liaison notified.
Case NOT spun to Judge Wagner, entry of 10/3/2014 as to spin made in error.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time, with credit for 4 DAYS time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 210 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 90 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Complete AODA evaluation.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Joelisa T, except for telephone contact and electronic contact, until completion of 8 BIP classes, and with agent approval.
-No contact with and her minor children, until completion of 8 BIP classes, and with agent approval.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 1 & 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 3 & 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court held in chambers conversation with state and defense. Motion Hearing proceed. Sworn for the state: Wauwatosa Police Officer Timothy Gold. Sworn for the state. Wauwatosa Police Officer Michael Otto. Arguments from state and defense, Court placed ruling on the record. Motion DENIED. State advised defense of new forthcoming charges. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 8/19/2014.
Received & Filed, State's Brief In Response To Defendant's Motion To Suppress.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C Mathers.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial Conference. State requested an adjournment of Final Pretrial with a Motion Hearing date. Court VACATED Jury Trial date of 7/21/2014. Case set for Final Pretrial/Motion Hearing and Jury Trial date in branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion To Adjourn.
Received & FIled, Notice of Motion and Motion To Suppress Evidence.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case recalled. Victim appeared in court. 
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Michael Otto.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-21-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present in court, Atty. P. Mathers.
Defense counsel motion to withdraw, as defendant has obtained private counsel, granted by the Court.  Preliminary hearing not heard on today's date, as Court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Defense counsel waives time limits as to preliminary hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.
Clerk:  jms
$1300.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joelisa T., JDP (2/06/07) and DTP (3/26/05).

Defendant Dennis D Penelton in court with attorney Mark S Tishberg.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defense enters not guilty plea to counts 2, 3 and 4 on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
